title: Mobile-based Program to Improve Socio-cultural Text Analysis Skills Using Language-Linguistic Intelligence

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency, digital device utilization skills, foundational understanding of socio-cultural phenomena (history, geography, economy, politics, civic rights, etc.), and elementary comprehension of social relationship analysis
context.additional_context: Smartphone-centric microlearning (3-5 weekly 15-20 minute modules). Provides multimedia socio-cultural analysis resources (historical videos, economic graphs, cultural comparison texts, political event analyses). Includes civic consciousness-building activities through social relationship analysis.

learning_goals: Learners improve reading-writing-speaking scores by over 30% through language-linguistic intelligence reinforcement activities over four weeks, cultivating analytical skills that consider social relationships and cultural contexts in sociocultural texts (including historical, geographical, and economic materials)

Learners independently perform and certify language reasoning activities (social context analysis, cultural implication inference, historical variable consideration, etc.) at least three times weekly via a mobile platform

Learners interpret three complex sociocultural texts (historical events, economic phenomena, cultural comparisons, etc.) of over 500 words each using linguistic thinking tools (mind maps, keyword linking, etc.), submit 10+ keyword connections (social relationships, historical variables, political elements, etc.) and three-tier mind maps (integrating political-economic-cultural elements) per text, and achieve over 80% scores in peer and instructor evaluations (clarity, logic, social insight criteria)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
